The bench headed by CJI is likely to seek responses from West Bengal and Union governments about addressing this issue.It may also decide to implead all states and Union Territories as parties to the case if it were to lay down a pan-India safety guideline.Another factor which may have forced SC to take up the case was the Aug 14 midnight vandalism at the Kolkata hospital that was allegedly aimed at foiling a planned rally by doctors and students in solidarity with simultaneous “reclaim the night” marches across the city. The mob targeted patients, staff, medical equipment and hospital property. Nurses, security guards, and even visitors were traumatised by threats given by the mob. Subsequently, high court rapped state government for its inability to provide security to medical and healthcare professionals and staff at the hospital.Interestingly, an SC bench of Justices Sanjiv Khanna, Sanjay Karol and Sanjay Kumar had dismissed a writ petition filed by Delhi Medical Association and Dr Satyajit Borah last month seeking adequate security for medical and healthcare professionals citing numerous incidents of violent attacks on doctors by irate relatives of patients.Justice Khanna-led bench told senior advocate Vijay Hansaria that the SC cannot direct the government to bring in a legislation in this regard. Observing that anybody who indulges in violence can be dealt with under the penal code, the bench had said that the only question is the implementation of the law.
Article Summary: CJI D Y Chandrachud ordered registration of suo motu criminal writ petition. A bench also comprising Justices J B Pardiwala and Manoj Misra will initiate proceedings on Tuesday. Calcutta HC had transferred to probe to CBI expressing reservations about Kolkata police's probe into the case.

Article Title: 70 Padma awardee doctors write to PM Modi, seek intervention to ensure justice in Kolkata case
Article Text: NEW DELHI: At least 70 Padma awardee doctors have written to Prime Minister Narendra Modi for his personal intervention to ensure justice is done in the brutal rape and murder of a young doctor in a Kolkata hospital last week."As the head of our nation, we implore your immediate and personal intervention to address this alarming situation. Such acts of brutality shake the very foundations of service by medical professionals and highlight the urgent need to address violence, particularly against women, girls, and healthcare professionals," the Padma awardee doctors' letter to the PM states.The Padma awardee doctors who have signed on the letter include radiologist Dr Harsh Mahajan, former AIIMS director Dr Randeep Guleria, ex-ICMR director general Dr Balram Bhargava and neurologist Dr M V Padma Srivastava among others.The letter suggests measures such as rigorous application of current legal frameworks to protect healthcare professionals, harsher and time-bound punishments for perpetrators of sexual violence and enhanced safety measures in hospitals and medical institutions."We urge the central and state governments to quickly enact and implement a separate law for the protection of healthcare workers, ensuring its rapid enforcement on the ground. A proposed bill, 'The Prevention of Violence Against Doctors, Medical Professionals and Medical Institutions Bill,' has been ready since 2019 but has not yet been tabled in Parliament for passage and adoption. We strongly believe that an ordinance to this effect can be brought immediately, and the bill should be passed post-haste so that all those working in healthcare delivery systems in the country can work without fear, in service of suffering patients," the letter adds.Earlier, on Saturday, the Indian Medical Association (IMA) had written to the PM to demand a central law to protect healthcare workers from violence, in addition to beefing up the security protocols of all hospitals to the level of security provided at the airports.
Article Summary: At least 70 Padma awardee doctors have written to Prime Minister Narendra Modi for his personal intervention to ensure justice is done in the brutal rape and murder of a young doctor in a Kolkata hospital last week. The letter suggests measures such as rigorous application of current legal frameworks to protect healthcare professionals, harsher and time-bound punishments for perpetrators of sexual violence.

Article Title: 24x7 vigil must to stop threats from sea, says Rajnath Singh in Tamil Nadu
Article Text: NEW DELHI: All maritime agencies must maintain a 24x7 vigil and a pro-active approach to thwart both conventional and non-conventional threats emanating from the sea, defence minister Rajnath Singh said on Sunday, while inaugurating new Coast Guard facilities in south India.The facilities include a maritime rescue coordination centre (MRCC) and regional marine pollution response centre (RMPRC) at Chennai as well as an air enclave at Puducherry."These will ensure robust maritime security and provide efficient responses to emergencies, reinforcing the country's commitment to maritime safety and environmental protection," an official said.The MRCC, with the latest equipment for monitoring by terrestrial and satellite systems and advanced communication systems, will enhance air and sea operations to rescue mariners and fishermen in distress at sea. It will serve as the nerve centre for coordinating all maritime rescue operations on the east coast of India and beyond.The RMPRC, in turn, is the first of its kind facility for coordinating the response against marine pollution, especially oil and chemical spills. First announced by Singh during a Indo-Asean meeting in Cambodia in Nov 2022, the centre will also train Indian and foreign personnel in the arena."The air enclave, equipped with Chetak and advanced light helicopters, will play a vital role in maritime security along the Puducherry-south Tamil Nadu coast," the official said.
Article Summary: The facilities include a maritime rescue coordination centre (MRCC) and regional marine pollution response centre (RMPRC) at Chennai as well as an air enclave at Puducherry. The MRCC will serve as the nerve centre for coordinating all maritime rescue operations on the east coast of India and beyond.

Article Title: Bid to deprive 'PDA' of quota: Akhilesh Yadav
Article Text: Attacking the NDA government over the appointment of bureaucrats at the Centre through lateral entry, Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav Sunday said it is a part of BJP's conspiracy to deprive "PDA" (picchde, Dalit, alpsankhyak) of reservation benefits.He said lateral entry was BJP's channel to post "ideologically aligned" officers on high positions and it was time for a nationwide protest from October 2.PDA stands for backward classes, Dalits, and minorities who had voted in favour of the SP in Lok Sabha polls helping the party secure 37 seats in UP.
Article Summary: Akhilesh Yadav said lateral entry was BJP's channel to post "ideologically aligned" officers on high positions. PDA stands for backward classes, Dalits, and minorities who had voted in favour of SP in Lok Sabha polls helping the party secure 37 seats in UP.

Article Title: Lateral entry will snatch quota from SCs, STs & OBCs: Rahul Gandhi
Article Text: New Delhi: Leader of opposition in the Lok Sabha Rahul Gandhi on Sunday attacked the Modi government over UPSC inviting applications for mid-tier posts to be filled laterally on contract basis, alleging that the move was a step towards ending SC, ST and OBC quotas by privatising the IAS.TOI reported on Sunday that UPSC, as part of a drive to have lateral entrants, has advertised 45 mid-level posts of director, joint secretary and deputy secretary in various ministries and departments for jobs requiring specialisation."The INDIA bloc will strongly oppose this anti-national step that hurts both the administrative structure and social justice," Gandhi said in a post in Hindi on X. "Narendra Modi by doing recruitment of public servants through RSS instead of UPSC is attacking the Constitution," Gandhi said. He further alleged that the reservation of SC, ST and OBCs is being "openly snatched away by recruiting through lateral entry on important posts in various ministries of the central government.""I have always said that the underprivileged are not represented in the country's top posts including the top bureaucracy," Rahul said, alleging that the lateral entry would push the underprivileged category further away form top posts. Gandhi added. He went on to allege that instead of taking measures to improve the situation, by resorting to "lateral entry" those from the underprivileged category are being pushed further away from the top posts.RJD chief Lalu Prasad Yadav also alleged that the advertisement brought out by UPSC on the advice of PM Narendra Modi and NDA allies is an "attack on Ambedkar's Constitution and the provisions of reservation."He attributed the move to RSS's influence, saying that it represented "Nagpur Model" of "directly recruiting from the corporate sector BJP's private army that is those who wear khaki pants to top posts", alleging that in this "Sanghi model" there is no place for reservation for Dalits, backward and tribals.
Article Summary: UPSC has advertised 45 mid-level posts of director, joint secretary and deputy secretary in various ministries and departments for jobs requiring specialisation. Gandhi: "Narendra Modi by doing recruitment of public servants through RSS instead of UPSC is attacking the Constitution" RJD chief Lalu Prasad Yadav also alleged that the advertisement brought out by UPSC on the advice of PM Narendra Modi and NDA allies is an "attack on Ambedkar's Constitution"

Article Title: Bangladesh Hindus now 9% due to forced conversions: Amit Shah
Article Text: GANDHINAGAR: The Hindu population in Bangladesh has drastically reduced from 27% during Partition to 9% today due to forced conversions and displacement, home minister Amit Shah said Sunday in Ahmedabad."Where have the rest gone? They were either subjected to forced religious conversion or sought refuge in India. Don't they have the right to live as per their religion? If they can't live with respect in the neighbouring country and seek refuge in our country, what should we do? We can't sit as silent spectators.This is Modi government, you will get justice," Shah asserted.The event marked the granting of citizenship certificates to 188 Hindu refugees who had come from Pakistan before Dec 31, 2014. Shah emphasised that the Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA) aims to provide rights and justice to refugees and assured the Muslim community that the law does not revoke anyone's citizenship, but it facilitates granting it.Shah also took the opportunity to criticise past Congress-led governments, accusing them of delaying citizenship for refugees due to appeasement politics. "Those who sought refuge in India were denied citizenship from 1947 to 2014," Shah said. "They (refugees) weren't just tortured in neighbouring countries for being Hindu, Jain, Buddhist and Sikh, but also in our country as lakhs and crores of people longed for justice for three generations."He said while intruders were made citizens illegally in the past, those who followed the law and applied for citizenship were denied. "From this forum I would like to ask those who ran past govts as to what was the fault of the people, who came here to save their sisters and daughters and their properties, that they could not become citizens of this country?"In contrast, Shah praised PM Modi's government for acting on promises and reforms. He highlighted the abolition of Article 370, the ending of triple talaq, and the amendments to the citizenship law as key achievements under PM Modi's leadership."After the law (CAA) was passed, everyone was misled that this would cause injustice to Muslims and they would lose their citizenship. Today, I want to make it clear again to the Muslim community that there is no provision in this law to take away anyone's citizenship. This law works to grant citizenship," Shah said.He urged refugees across India to apply for citizenship without fear, assuring them that the process would not affect their jobs or properties and would be granted with retrospective effect. "The law has no provision for criminal cases. Everyone is pardoned because the delay was due to government, not you," he said.
Article Summary: The Hindu population in Bangladesh has drastically reduced from 27% during Partition to 9% today due to forced conversions and displacement. Shah emphasised that the Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA) aims to provide rights and justice to refugees. He assured the Muslim community that the law does not revoke anyone's citizenship, but it facilitates granting it.

Article Title: 'Towering figure': PM tribute to Karunanidhi on centenary
Article Text: CHENNAI: Prime Minister Narendra Modi led the tributes to former Tamil Nadu CM and DMK patriarch M Karunanidhi as the Centre released Sunday a commemorative coin marking the departed politician's centenary .In a letter to Karunanidhi's son and current CM M K Stalin, the PM praised the DMK stalwart, describing him as a "towering figure" in Indian politics, literature, and society.Modi's sentiments were shared in a post on platform X by Stalin, who expressed gratitude, saying: "I wholeheartedly thank Hon'ble Prime Minister Thiru. @narendramodi avl. for his kind wishes and support..."Stalin expressed pride in the national recognition of his father's legacy, saying: "I am happy that the entire country is celebrating Kalaignar through the centenary coin."Defence minister Rajnath Singh, who officially unveiled the coin at a ceremony in Chennai, remembered Karunanidhi as a national figure. "A man whose influence extended far beyond Tamil Nadu, Karunanidhi was a titan of Indian politics, a cultural stalwart, and a relentless advocate for social justice," Singh said.Congress MP Rahul Gandhi also paid tribute , highlighting Karunanidhi's progressive vision. "Kalaignar Karunanidhi's socially progressive vision and unwavering dedication to empowering people paved the way for millions to live a life of dignity," he said. He credited Karunanidhi's leadership for transforming Tamil Nadu.Earlier in the day, Singh and Stalin visited Karunanidhi's memorial at Marina Beach in Chennai. The ceremony also saw the attendance of BJP state president K Annamalai, who was seated in the front row.
Article Summary: PM Narendra Modi leads tributes to former Tamil Nadu CM and DMK patriarch M Karunanidhi. Centre releases commemorative coin marking the departed politician's centenary. Defence minister Rajnath Singh, who officially unveiled the coin at a ceremony in Chennai.

Article Title: Will go alone in assembly polls: J&K BJP chief Ravinder Raina
Article Text: JAMMU: BJP will not form any pre-poll alliance with other parties for the upcoming assembly elections in Jammu & Kashmir, state BJP chief Ravinder Raina said on Sunday.He said the party is in touch with 9-10 independent candidates in Kashmir valley. “If these discussions materialize, we will formulate a strategy to contest the polls together. BJP will announce the first list of candidates soon,” he said.Welcoming former state minister Zulfkar Ali into the party, Raina recalled that Ali had launched several development projects for the welfare of the people during his term in the cabinet.
Article Summary: State BJP chief Ravinder Raina said the party is in touch with 9-10 independent candidates in Kashmir valley. Raina welcomed former state minister Zulfkar Ali into the party. He recalled that Ali had launched several development projects for the welfare of the people during his term in the cabinet.

Article Title: Ex-minister, J&K Apni Party founder Zulfkar joins BJP ahead of polls
Article Text: JAMMU: Former J&K minister and a founding member of J&K Apni Party, Chowdhary Zulfkar Ali , joined the BJP on Sunday at the party headquarters in Jammu, close on the heels of election commission announcing assembly polls in J&K, starting September 18.Zulfkar was inducted by Union minister and BJP’s J&K assembly election in-charge G Kishan Reddy, BJP national general secretary Tarun Chugh, J&K BJP president Ravinder Raina and Union minister of state for PMO Jitendra Singh.On Saturday, he had met Union home minister Amit Shah in Delhi.Zulfkar said he joined BJP for the welfare of the ST community and the progress of Rajouri-Poonch area.“We remained part of the govt in J&K but always lived in fear. We were scared and in order to survive, we had to be part of National Conference,” Zulfkar said.He has been a cabinet minister in J&K from 2015 to 2018 and handled departments like food and civil supplies and tribal affairs.
Article Summary: Chowdhary Zulfkar Ali joined the BJP on Sunday at the party headquarters in Jammu. He was inducted by Union minister and BJP’s J&K assembly election in- charge G Kishan Reddy. He said he joined BJP for the welfare of the ST community and the progress of Rajouri-Poonch area.

Article Title: Ghulam Nabi Azad’s party rejects speculation about merger with Congress
Article Text:
Democratic Progressive Azad Party (DPAP) chairman Ghulam Nabi Azad (ANI photo)

JAMMU: Amid speculation on social media about Ghulam Nabi Azad’s plan to rejoin Congress , his Democratic Progressive Azad Party (DPAP) dismissed the “rumour” on Sunday."Congress functionaries have been spreading false and baseless rumours over the past two weeks to break our party," said DPAP chief spokesperson Salman Nizami.Denying reports that Congress top brass had approached Azad to merge DPAP into Congress, Nizami said that neither Azad nor any Congress functionary had met or spoken on the phone.He added that Azad has requested party workers not to fall into the Congress trap.
Article Summary: Ghulam Nabi Azad’s Democratic Progressive Azad Party (DPAP) dismissed the “rumour’ on Sunday. DPAP chief spokesperson Salman Nizami said that neither Azad nor any Congress functionary had met or spoken on the phone.

Article Title: BJP failed to reciprocate the contribution of people from Jind in past 10 years: Kumari Selja
Article Text: CHANDIGARH: AICC general secretary and Lok Sabha MP from Sirsa Kumari Selja said on Sunday that the incumbent BJP government has not only failed in the state but has miserably failed to reciprocate to the contribution of people of Jind in the past ten years.The former union minister, who also holds the charge of Uttrakhand Congress said that Jind district is a revolutionary district, but it has not received what it deserved.Jind district has been subjected to discrimination. In the last ten years under the BJP government, Jind has seen more neglect than ever before.Accompanied by Rajya Sabha MP Randeep Surjewala , Mahila Congress president Sudha Bhardwaj and other senior Congress leaders, she was addressing a rally in Jind . Selja said that the BJP will have to account for its ten years in power.The BJP is making promises about MSP, but they should clarify what law they have made for MSP. She said that the BJP government has mistreated various sections of society, including Dalits, employees, backward classes, farmers, women, and traders. This is why all sections are angry with the BJP, and the public will take revenge on October 1 with the power of their votes.i Selja said that due to the BJP's anti-people mindset, there is an outcry among all 36 communities today. She said that scholarships have been stopped so that children cannot study, and there are scams in jobs. Youths are forced to go abroad for employment. She said that anyone who raises their voice for their rights is beaten with sticks. She urged the people that the time has come to get rid of such a government.The Rajya Sabha MP Randeep Singh Surjewala said that he was confident that Rahul Gandhi and Kharge will soon begin the battle for change in power in Haryana, starting from Jind. He said that Jind has faced discrimination in development under the BJP government. There has been no work done in the name of development. Crime has increased to such an extent that people are living in an atmosphere of fear. Government job exams are being sold, which is why the youth do not see a bright future and are moving abroad.
Article Summary: AICC general secretary and Lok Sabha MP from Sirsa Kumari Selja said on Sunday that the incumbent BJP government has not only failed in the state but has miserably failed to reciprocate to the contribution of people of Jind. She said that scholarships have been stopped so that children cannot study and there are scams in jobs.

Article Title: IIT Madras: Seven corporation school students qualify for IIT-M online course
Article Text: COIMBATORE: Under the ‘ Anaivarukkum IIT-Madras ’ (IIT-Madras for All) initiative, seven students from Coimbatore Corporation schools have secured seats at the Indian Institute of Technology-Madras (IIT-M) for the online Bachelor of Science (BS) Degree in Data Science and Applications .Out of the 67 students who appeared for the exam, seven qualified and will be joining the course.Among them, three students belong to the SC community , and for these students, the fees will be fully covered by IIT Madras and the TamilNadu Adi Dravidar Housing & Development Corporation (TAHDCO)."This achievement is the result of a collaboration between IIT Madras, Coimbatore Corporation, and TAHDCO, where we trained and motivated students to aim for IIT. We also guided students from arts backgrounds (those without a Maths & Science background), showing them that they can pursue an IIT Madras degree without needing to clear the JEE. Under the ‘Anaivarukkum IIT-Madras’ initiative, school students who appeared for their Class XI final exams could apply for the course, regardless of their board," said the project head, N Hari Krishnan.Those who qualify can join the programme after completing Class XII. The programme is open to anyone who has completed Class XII, regardless of age or professional background. Launched by IIT-M in 2021, the programme provides an alternative path to obtaining a prestigious degree.“Coaching for the exam is provided by IIT-M. The exam questions are based on the four-week course conducted by IIT, so separate coaching isn’t required,” Krishnan added.The four-year course costs Rs. 3.51 lakh. IIT is offering a 75% concession to students whose family income is less than Rs. 1 lakh and a 50% concession to students whose family income is between Rs. 1 lakh and Rs. 5 lakh. Students also have the flexibility to take extended breaks between academic years to manage financial responsibilities.The next batch of the IIT-M BS programme starts in September 2024, and applications are currently open. For more information, students can visit https://study.iitm.ac.in/
Article Summary: Seven students from Coimbatore Corporation schools have secured seats at the Indian Institute of Technology-Madras. Out of the 67 students who appeared for the exam, seven qualified and will be joining the course. Launched by IIT-M in 2021, the programme provides an alternative path to obtaining a prestigious degree.

Article Title: Suicide: Uttar Pradesh guest worker dies by suicide in Madurai
Article Text: Madurai: A 20-year-old guest worker from Uttar Pradesh who was working at a furniture industrial unit in Madurai was found to have died by suicide inside his room where he was staying allegedly over personal issues .According to the police , the deceased youth was identified as Ash Mohamed , 20, of Saharanpur in Uttar Pradesh. Mohamed, along with his younger brother Abubakar , 18, and around others from UP were staying together in Madurai for the past four months.They were employed by a private furniture industrial unit at Jaihindpuram in Madurai city.However, on Saturday morning, Mohamed was found to have died by suicide likely the previous night by hanging himself inside his room where they were staying in at the furniture industrial unit in Jaihindpuram. Based on his brother Abubakar's statement, the Jaihindpuram police registered a case. The body of the deceased was recovered and sent for post mortem examination.Police said that as per preliminary enquiries, Mohamed is said to have had a lover he wished to marry back at his village in UP but his family was yet to arrange for the wedding. They added that Mohamed is suspected to have been depressed due to the delay in marriage and may have taken the extreme step.
Article Summary: 20-year-old guest worker from Uttar Pradesh found to have died by suicide inside his room where he was staying allegedly over personal issues. Police said that as per preliminary enquiries, Mohamed is said to have had a lover he wished to marry back at his village in UP but his family was yet to arrange the wedding.

Article Title: Severe heatwave in Terai region impacts dragon fruit production
Article Text: RUDRAPUR: The unusually high temperatures in the Terai region this year have severely affected dragon fruit cultivation , resulting in substantial losses to farmers. The intense heatwave, exacerbated by the El Nino phenomenon, caused temperatures to soar to 44°C in May and June, leading to stunted growth and reduced fruit weight, according to officials of the horticulture department , Udham Singh Nagar .Dragon fruit, a perennial cactus known for its medicinal properties, requires a warm climate with an annual rainfall of at least 50 cm, and temperatures ranging from 20-36°C for optimal growth. However, farmers said that excessive heat this year resulted in a significant decrease in fruit size, with most dragon fruits weighing between just 6-150 grams, much lower than the expected 250-600 grams. Consequently, they have been unable to generate profits from their crops.Yatin Singhal, a farmer from Kashipur who has been cultivating dragon fruit for the past four years and encountered similar challenges with his crop, said, “This season, about 80% of the fruits weighed only 6-150 grams. Only 20% managed to reach 200-250 grams.”Prabhakar Singh, chief horticulture officer of Udham Singh Nagar, said, “The extreme heat during El Nino affected the production of dragon fruit, leading to insufficient growth and reduced weight. Despite setbacks, there is hope for improved production post-monsoon and more favourable growing conditions.”
Article Summary: The intense heatwave, exacerbated by the El Nino phenomenon, caused temperatures to soar to 44°C in May and June. Dragon fruit requires a warm climate with an annual rainfall of at least 50 cm, and temperatures ranging from 20-36°C for optimal growth.

Article Title: BSF recovers heroin near Indo-Pak border in Ferozepur
Article Text: FEROZEPUR: Border Security Force claim to have recovered heroin , probably dropped by a drone near border village in Ferozepur on Saturday night. BSF intelligence wing shared information regarding presence of a packet of narcotics in the border area of district Ferozepur.Acting promptly, BSF troops conducted an extensive search operation in the suspected area.During the search operation, troops successfully recovered one packet of heroin (500 grams) from a farming field adjacent to village Machhiwara in district Ferozepur.The narcotics were packed in a plastic container which was wrapped in yellow colour adhesive tape and red colour tape along with one improvised hook. Reliable input of BSF intelligence wing and quick response of BSF troops foiled yet another illicit attempt of drugs smuggling from across the border. With the recovery of improvised hook with the packet, it looks to have been dropped through a drone. Further investigations are on.
Article Summary: BSF claim to have recovered heroin, probably dropped by a drone near border village in Ferozepur on Saturday night. The narcotics were packed in a plastic container which was wrapped in yellow colour adhesive tape and red colour tape. With the recovery of improvised hook with the packet, it looks to have been dropped through a drone.
